speaker: Former Teammate
text: Hey! Long time no see. What have you been up to?
ipa: heɪ | lɔŋ taɪm noʊ si | ˈwɑɾəv jə bɪn ʌp tu
stress: HEY | LONG TIME no SEE | WHAT have YOU been UP to
linking:
"what have you" → /ˈwɑɾəv jə/ (flap T and reduction)
"been up to" → /bɪn ʌp tu/ (natural linking)

speaker: You
text: Hey! Great to see you too. I’ve been working at a fintech startup for the last 8 months — we’ve been building a new payment system from scratch.
ipa: heɪ | ɡreɪt tə si ju tu | aɪv bɪn ˈwɜrkɪŋ æt ə ˈfɪntek ˈstɑrtʌp fɚ ðə læst eɪt mʌnθs | wiv bɪn ˈbɪldɪŋ ə nu ˈpeɪmənt ˈsɪstəm frəm skrætʃ
stress: HEY | GREAT to SEE YOU TOO | I’VE been WORKING at a FINTECH STARTUP | LAST 8 MONTHS | BUILDING a NEW PAYMENT SYSTEM from SCRATCH
linking:
"great to" → /ɡreɪt tə/ (reduced 'to')
"working at a" → /ˈwɜrkɪŋ æt ə/ (smooth blend)
"from scratch" → /frəm skrætʃ/ (common reduction)

speaker: Former Teammate
text: Wow, sounds intense. What stack are you using?
ipa: waʊ | saʊndz ɪnˈtɛns | wʌt stæk ɚ ju ˈjuzɪŋ
stress: WOW | SOUNDS INTENSE | WHAT STACK are YOU USING

speaker: You
text: Mostly TypeScript and PostgreSQL. We’ve been using Prisma as our ORM, and I’ve been diving deep into performance tuning lately. Actually, I’ve just finished optimizing one of our most critical queries — it had been causing latency spikes for weeks.
ipa: ˈmoʊstli ˈtaɪpskrɪpt ənd ˌpoʊstɡrəˈɛsˌkjuːˈɛl | wiv bɪn ˈjuzɪŋ ˈprɪzmə æz aʊɚ ˌoʊɑrˈɛm | ənd aɪv bɪn ˈdaɪvɪŋ dip ˈɪntu pɚˈfɔrməns ˈtunɪŋ ˈleɪtli | ˈækʧuəli | aɪv ʤəst ˈfɪnɪʃt ˈɑptəˌmaɪzɪŋ ˈwʌn əv aʊɚ moʊst ˈkrɪtɪkəl ˈkwɛriz | ɪt həd bɪn ˈkɑzɪŋ ˈleɪtənsi spaɪks fɚ wiks
stress: MOSTLY TYPESCRIPT and POSTGRESQL | WE’VE BEEN USING PRISMA as OUR ORM | DIVING DEEP into PERFORMANCE TUNING LATELY | FINISHED OPTIMIZING one of OUR MOST CRITICAL QUERIES | CAUSING LATENCY SPIKES for WEEKS
linking:
"been using" → /bɪn ˈjuzɪŋ/ (smooth link)
"as our ORM" → /æz aʊɚ ˌoʊɑrˈɛm/ (smooth flow)
"had been causing" → /həd bɪn ˈkɑzɪŋ/ (reduction and link)

speaker: Former Teammate
text: That’s cool. Do you miss the old days at the agency?
ipa: ðæts kul | dʊ jə mɪs ði oʊld deɪz æt ði ˈeɪʤənsi
stress: THAT’S COOL | DO YOU MISS the OLD DAYS at the AGENCY
linking:
"do you" → /dʊ jə/ (link 'do' to 'you')
"days at" → /deɪz æt/ (link 'days' to 'at')

speaker: You
text: Sometimes! We used to ship stuff so fast. Remember how we would release a feature within two days of planning?
ipa: ˈsʌmtaɪmz | wi ˈjuzd tə ʃɪp stʌf soʊ fæst | rɪˈmɛmbɚ haʊ wi wʊd rɪˈlis ə ˈfiʧɚ wɪˈðɪn tu deɪz əv ˈplænɪŋ
stress: SOMETIMES | WE USED TO SHIP STUFF SO FAST | REMEMBER HOW WE WOULD RELEASE A FEATURE WITHIN TWO DAYS of PLANNING
linking:
"used to" → /ˈjuzd tə/ (common reduction)
"release a" → /rɪˈlis ə/ (linking 'release' to 'a')

speaker: Former Teammate
text: Oh yeah — and we used to push to production without proper code review. Wild times.
ipa: oʊ jæ — ənd wi ˈjuzd tə pʊʃ tə prəˈdʌkʃən wɪˈðaʊt ˈprɑpɚ koʊd rɪˈvju | waɪld taɪmz
stress: OH YEAH — and WE USED TO PUSH TO PRODUCTION WITHOUT PROPER CODE REVIEW | WILD TIMES

speaker: You
text: Seriously. I’ve realized how much I’ve grown since then. I’ve become a lot more intentional with my decisions. Like, I’ve been spending more time designing before I even touch the code.
ipa: ˈsɪriəsli | aɪv ˈriəˌlaɪzd haʊ mʌʧ aɪv ɡroʊn sɪns ðɛn | aɪv bɪˈkʌm ə lɑt mɔr ɪnˈtɛnʃənəl wɪð maɪ dɪˈsɪʒənz | laɪk | aɪv bɪn ˈspɛndɪŋ mɔr taɪm dɪˈzaɪnɪŋ bɪˈfɔr aɪ ˈivən tʌʧ ðə koʊd
stress: SERIOUSLY | I’VE REALIZED HOW MUCH I’VE GROWN SINCE THEN | BECOME MORE INTENTIONAL with MY DECISIONS | SPENDING MORE TIME DESIGNING BEFORE I EVEN TOUCH the CODE
linking:
"realized how" → /ˈriəˌlaɪzd haʊ/ (linked ending and start)
"before I even" → /bɪˈfɔr aɪ ˈivən/ (smooth reduction)

speaker: Former Teammate
text: Same here. What’s one thing you wish you had learned earlier?
ipa: seɪm hɪɹ | wʌts wʌn θɪŋ ju wɪʃ ju həd lɝnd ɝliɚ
stress: SAME HERE | WHAT’S ONE THING you WISH you had LEARNED EARLIER
linking:
"what’s one" → /wʌts wʌn/ (linking 'what's' to 'one')
"you wish" → /ju wɪʃ/ (smooth connection)
"had learned" → /həd lɝnd/ (reduction of 'had')

speaker: You
text: Honestly? Writing clean pull request descriptions. There were times when I had written something vague, and by the time the reviewer asked for changes, I had already forgotten what the logic was supposed to do.
ipa: ˈɑnəstli | ˈɹaɪtɪŋ klin pʊl ɹɪˈkwɛst dɪˈskɹɪpʃənz | ðɛɹ wɚ taɪmz wɛn aɪ həd ˈɹɪtən ˈsʌmθɪŋ veɪɡ | ənd baɪ ðə taɪm ðə ɹɪˈvjuɚ æskt fɚ ˈʧeɪnʤɪz | aɪ həd ɔlˈɹɛdi fɚˈɡɑtn wʌt ðə ˈlɑʤɪk wəz səˈpoʊzd tə du
stress: HONESTLY | WRITING CLEAN PULL REQUEST DESCRIPTIONS | THERE WERE TIMES WHEN I HAD WRITTEN SOMETHING VAGUE | AND BY THE TIME THE REVIEWER ASKED FOR CHANGES | I HAD ALREADY FORGOTTEN WHAT THE LOGIC WAS SUPPOSED TO DO
linking:
"there were" → /ðɛɹ wɚ/ (linking 'there' to 'were')
"had written" → /həd ˈɹɪtən/ (reduction of 'had')
"by the time" → /baɪ ðə taɪm/ (smooth connection)
"supposed to" → /səˈpoʊzd tə/ (reduction of 'to')

speaker: Former Teammate
text: Haha, been there. Any project that really challenged you?
ipa: ˈhɑˌhɑ | bɪn ðɛɹ | ˈɛni ˈpɹɑʤɛkt ðæt ˈɹɪli ˈʧælɪnʤd ju
stress: HAHA | BEEN THERE | ANY PROJECT THAT REALLY CHALLENGED YOU
linking:
"been there" → /bɪn ðɛɹ/ (smooth connection)
"challenged you" → /ˈʧælɪnʤd ju/ (linking 'challenged' to 'you')

speaker: You
text: Yeah — last quarter, we had to integrate with a legacy system. The devs had left, and nobody had touched the code in years. I had spent days just reading outdated docs before I even figured out where to start. It was painful, but I’ve learned a ton.
ipa: jæ — læst ˈkwɔɹtɚ | wi həd tə ˈɪntəˌɡɹeɪt wɪð ə ˈlɛɡəsi ˈsɪstəm | ðə dɛvz həd lɛft | ənd ˈnoʊˌbɑdi həd tʌʧt ðə koʊd ɪn jɪɹz | aɪ həd spɛnt deɪz ʤəst ˈɹiːdɪŋ ˌaʊtˈdeɪtɪd dɑks bɪˈfɔɹ aɪ ˈivən ˈfɪɡjɚd aʊt wɛɹ tə stɑɹt | ɪt wəz ˈpeɪnfəl | bət aɪv lɝnd ə tʌn
stress: YEAH — LAST QUARTER | WE HAD TO INTEGRATE WITH A LEGACY SYSTEM | THE DEVS HAD LEFT | AND NOBODY HAD TOUCHED THE CODE IN YEARS | I HAD SPENT DAYS JUST READING OUTDATED DOCS BEFORE I EVEN FIGURED OUT WHERE TO START | IT WAS PAINFUL | BUT I’VE LEARNED A TON
linking:
"had to" → /həd tə/ (reduction of 'had')
"integrate with a" → /ˈɪntəˌɡɹeɪt wɪð ə/ (smooth connection)
"before I even" → /bɪˈfɔɹ aɪ ˈivən/ (linking 'before' to 'I')

speaker: Former Teammate
linking:
"you’ve come" → /juv kʌm/ (contraction of 'you have')
"come a" → /kʌm ə/ (smooth connection)

speaker: You
text: Thanks! I’ve definitely been pushing myself more lately. I’ve been working on some open-source stuff after hours, and it’s helped me keep learning new tools.
ipa: θæŋks | aɪv ˈdɛfənətli bɪn ˈpʊʃɪŋ maɪˈsɛlf mɔɹ ˈleɪtli | aɪv bɪn ˈwɜrkɪŋ ɑn səm ˈoʊpən sɔɹs stʌf ˈæftɚ ˈaʊɚz | ənd ɪts hɛlpt mi kip ˈlɝnɪŋ nu tulz
stress: THANKS | I’VE DEFINITELY BEEN PUSHING MYSELF MORE LATELY | I’VE BEEN WORKING ON SOME OPEN-SOURCE STUFF AFTER HOURS | AND IT’S HELPED ME KEEP LEARNING NEW TOOLS
linking:
